title: ESMO Congress 2023: Registration
cleaned_text: IMPORTANT NOTE We would like to alert our members and delegates to be aware of possible scams and to strongly advise you to only register through our website by using the official ESMO Congress Registration System. Registration is now open Late registration deadline: 13 September 2023 at 23:59 CEST The ESMO Congress 2023 will take place on-site in Madrid, Spain and online in a virtual format. During the registration process delegates will be asked to indicate on-site or online participation. N.B. On-site participation also includes access to the online platform. An [ESMO account](https://esmo.force.com/esmo/s/login/?ec=302&startURL=%2Fesmo%2Fs%2F) is required to register yourself, or a group. Registration fees and deadlines Individual registration will remain open for the duration of the Congress. The ESMO Congress Secretariat must receive one completed registration per participant and the corresponding payment in EUR by the given deadlines. ESMO membership must be active seven (7) days prior to the registration deadline for the reduced member registration fee to be applied. At the time of application, developing countries are defined by ESMO according to the World Bank classification of low, lower-middle and upper-middle countries based on the Gross National Income (GNI) per capita. [Download the PDF](/content/download/7888/165024/1/ESMO-Developing-Countries-List.pdf) outlining which countries are eligible for the discounted registration fees. ** ESMO members must be under 40 and in training to qualify for this fee. ***To benefit of the EONS fee please register [here](https://forms.gle/vLdBdsKoyRy87H1dA) In-person participation includes: - Admission to on-site scientific and educational sessions with the possibility to interact with Speakers, Chairs and panels. - On-site networking opportunity with Faculty and peers - Entry to the Poster area - Interaction with industry partners in the trade exhibition - Participation in the Industry Satellite Symposia - Access to the Virtual Platform to follow sessions live and/or view content on-demand, except for On-site Daily passes - Post-event resources, except for On-site Daily passes - Transportation pass, except for On-site Daily passes Online participation includes: - Access to the Virtual Platform, with live streaming of all sessions - Possibility to interact through the chat live - Access to e-Posters - Entry to the Virtual Exhibition - Participation in the Industry Satellite Symposia - Post-event resources | | Other registration fees for on-site only (21% Spanish VAT included) - virtual platform and transportation pass not included | | Fee | | Access | | Private Meeting badge | | € 121 | | Private meeting and business rooms only | | Exhibition Visitor badge | | € 121 | | Exhibition area only | | Industry Symposium badge | | € 121 | | Industry satellite area only | | Filming Crew member badge | | € 700 | | Venue common area, private meeting and business rooms Transportation pass Registered delegates (excluding registration for students, exhibitors, private meetings, industry symposia, filming crews and on-site daily badges) at the ESMO Congress 2023 will receive a free pass to the Madrid City Transportation System to easily travel to/from the Congress venue. The public transport card covers all trips on all means of transport within the central, metropolitan area (Zona A), including both IFEMA Madrid and Madrid Airport. Webcasts The Congress webcasts will be available for all delegates and will include all the sessions of the official programme where speaker permission is granted. Sessions from the official congress programme Registered delegates - ESMO Members: resource access on OncologyPRO from 9 November 2023 for 5 years - Non-Members: resource access on OncologyPRO from 9 November 2023 for 6 months ESMO Members not registered to the congress will have access to resources on OncologyPRO from 3 months after the end of the congress (from 22 January 2024) for 5 years. Satellite Symposia and ESMO Colloquia - Access to satellites and ESMO Colloquia will be open to all Members on OncologyPRO even if not registered to the congress - OncologyPRO sponsors' satellite symposia will be hosted on OncologyPRO for 2 years Health and safety It is each participant's responsibility to check and comply with the [latest health and travel regulations](https://www.exteriores.gob.es/Embajadas/dhaka/en/Comunicacion/Noticias/Paginas/Articulos/Covid19-Entry-requeriments-20sp22.aspx) to ensure a smooth and safe journey from the Country of origin to the event venue, and back. During the event, ESMO will apply health and safety protocols according to the latest local authority guidelines and regulations. In general, ESMO recommends - To apply precautions and measures according to formal guidance and personal medical history - To stay up-to-date with the vaccination status - To perform a Rapid Antigen Test and wear a mask in case of symptoms Hand sanitisers will be available throughout the venue; use of mask is at own discretion in the absence of symptoms. Confirmation By end-September 2023 delegates will receive the registration confirmation email and instructions on how to access the ESMO Congress 2023. Travel insurance ESMO requires recipients to purchase travel protection. Travel insurance is mandatory in order to protect delegates from the high cost of potential cancellation due to circumstances beyond the control of the congress organizer. Adequate travel protection is also highly recommended for all congress participants as it protects travelers from risks like loss of passport or checked baggage and may offer coverage for unexpected medical expenses. Having these risks covered ensures an additional layer of protection against financial loss. Support Customer service staff will be available during the congress to provide support and answer any questions you may have.
